Package enquiries

Class EnquiriesDB

  • Object
    • EnquiriesDB
  • public class EnquiriesDB
extends Object
    A database that stores all the existing enquiries in the system.
    Since:
    2023-11-17
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Soo Qi Yang, Teo Kai Xuan, Masagca Merwyn Louie Dumasis, Nguyen Phuong Linh, Tee Jeeng Yee

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private ICheckCampVisibility campVisibilityChecker
      An interface used by EnquiriesDB to check if the camp is even visible to the student.
      private ICheckSchoolMatch checkSchoolMatch
      An interface used by EnquiriesDB to check if the camp's faculty is open to the student.
      private ArrayList<Enquiry> enquiriesDB
      This is the EnquiriesDB's list of all enquiries.
      private static int enquiryIdCounter
      This stores the next ID to be assigned to the next enquiry.

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      EnquiriesDB​(ICheckSchoolMatch checkSchoolMatch, ICheckCampVisibility campVisibilityChecker)
      Creates a new EnquiriesDB object to store enquiries.

    • Field Detail

        private ArrayList<Enquiry> enquiriesDB
        This is the EnquiriesDB's list of all enquiries.

      • enquiryIdCounter

        private static int enquiryIdCounter
        This stores the next ID to be assigned to the next enquiry.

      • checkSchoolMatch

        private ICheckSchoolMatch checkSchoolMatch
        An interface used by EnquiriesDB to check if the camp's faculty is open to the student.

      • campVisibilityChecker

        private ICheckCampVisibility campVisibilityChecker
        An interface used by EnquiriesDB to check if the camp is even visible to the student.

    • Constructor Detail

      • EnquiriesDB

        public EnquiriesDB​(ICheckSchoolMatch checkSchoolMatch,
                   ICheckCampVisibility campVisibilityChecker)
        Creates a new EnquiriesDB object to store enquiries. This should only be called once to create a single database. It then tries to find a storage txt file to scan and initialise itself with any Enquiry entries that might have been stored from previous runs.
        Parameters:
        checkSchoolMatch - An interface used by EnquiriesDB to check if the camp's faculty is open to the student.
        campVisibilityChecker - An interface used by EnquiriesDB to check if the camp is even visible to the student.

    • Method Detail

      • writeToStorage

        public void writeToStorage()
                    throws IOException
        Writes this EnquiriesDB's array of Enquiry entries into a txt file. This should be called at the end of the application in order to save the database into a file.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws an exception if it is unable to find the file to read or write to.

      • readFromStorage

        public void readFromStorage()
                     throws IOException,
                            ClassNotFoundException
        Searches for the designated storage txt file to read in Enquiry data from previous app runs, and adds those Enquiry objects to this EnquiriesDB database. If there is no storage file, does not read in anything and no new Enquiry entries are added to this EnquiriesDB Database.
        Throws:
        IOException - Thrown if it is unable to find the file to read or write to.
        ClassNotFoundException - Thrown if unable to find class that we are trying to reference.

      • addReply

        public boolean addReply​(int enquiryNumber,
                        String replyText,
                        List<String> campList)
        Adds a reply to an Enquiry in EnquiriesDB database. Replies cannot be added to other replies. This should be used only for staff and camp committee members to reply to students' enquiries.

        Example: enquiriesDB.addReply(enquiryNumber, replyText, staff0.getCampsCreated());

        Parameters:
        enquiryNumber - Number of the enquiry to be replied.
        replyText - The reply text to the enquiry.
        campList - The list of camp names that the staff or camp committee member manages.
        Returns:
        Boolean to indicate if reply was successfully added. Could be used to add points for camp committee members.

      • sendEnquiry

        public void sendEnquiry​(String camp,
                        String text,
                        Student student)
        Sends an Enquiry to EnquiriesDB database. This should be used only for students to send enquiries to camps. Only allows enquiries to be sent for camps that are visible to the student.
        Parameters:
        camp - Camp name that the student wishes to enquire about.
        text - The enquiry about the camp.
        student - Student object that wishes to send an enquiry.

      • editEnquiry

        public void editEnquiry​(int enquiryNumber,
                        String newText,
                        String newCamp,
                        Student student)
        Edits an Enquiry in EnquiriesDB database. This should be used only for students to edit enquiries. Only allows enquiries to be sent for camps that are visible to the student. Enquiries can only be edited by the student that sent it and before the enquiry is processed (replied to).
        Parameters:
        enquiryNumber - Number of the enquiry to be edited.
        newText - The new text that the enquiry should be changed to.
        newCamp - The new camp that the enquiry is about.
        student - Student object that wishes to edit an enquiry.

      • deleteEnquiry

        public void deleteEnquiry​(int enquiryNumber,
                          String user)
        Deletes an Enquiry in EnquiriesDB database. This should be used only for students to delete enquiries. Enquiries can only be deleted by the student that sent it and before the enquiry is processed (replied to).
        Parameters:
        enquiryNumber - Number of the enquiry to be deleted.
        user - The name of student that wishes to delete an enquiry.

      • displayEnquiry

        private void displayEnquiry​(Enquiry enquiry,
                            int level)
        Internal method to print the details of and replies to an enquiry.
        Parameters:
        enquiry - Enquiry object details to be printed.
        level - Indicates if the enquiry object is a reply or not.

      • printEnquiryToFile

        private void printEnquiryToFile​(Enquiry enquiry,
                                int level,
                                PrintWriter printWriter)
        Internal method to print the details of and replies to an enquiry to a file.
        Parameters:
        enquiry - Enquiry object details to be printed.
        level - Indicates if the enquiry object is a reply or not.
        printWriter - A PrintWriter object that writes to the desired specified output file.

      • viewOwnEnquiry

        public void viewOwnEnquiry​(String user)
        Allows students to view their own enquiries and all replies to it in EnquiriesDB database. This should be used only by students.
        Parameters:
        user - The name of student that wishes to view his enquiries and all replies to him.

      • viewByCamp

        public void viewByCamp​(List<String> campList)
        Allows staff and camp committee members to view enquiries about camps managed by them and all replies. This should be used only by staff and camp committee members.
        Parameters:
        campList - The list of camp names that the staff or camp committee member manages.

      • enquiryReport

        public void enquiryReport​(List<String> campList,
                          String fileName)
        Allows staff and camp committee members to generate enquiry report about camps managed by them and all replies. This should be used only by staff and camp committee members.
        Parameters:
        campList - The list of camp names that the staff or camp committee member manages.
        fileName - The name of the file that the report is generated to

      • createFile

        private File createFile​(String fileName)
        Creates a file in the given file name and returns a File object if successful. Function fails if a file with the specified file name already exists.
        Parameters:
        fileName - The desired filename to generate the report to.
        Returns:
        The successfully created file, or null on failure.
